title: Which tier 3 runes to buy first?
body:
So I am nearing level 20 and have a fair amount of IP saved up. I want to know what, if any, are the best runes to buy that are not only best in slot (or close)  but also serve a wide variety of champions?

I have read a few posts about this but they are all WAY out of date so I am looking for some up to date advice.

Help?

replies.body:
Goes on both pages: 
Armor Yellows
MR Blues

For your AP Page:
AP Quints
Magic Penetration Reds

For your AD Page: 
AD Quints
AD Reds
This^ is the basic setup for everyone with two pages.
For those that apply, should I get scaling or flat?

I'd grab flat to start out with if you're trying to put together a couple of general rune pages (such as those Very Toxic Jinx has outlined). There are some cases where scaling's a great choice, flat's usually the better option though.

> [{quoted}](name=IceTPain,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dMmi6ht0,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-01-08T03:28:31.834+0000)
>
> For those that apply, should I get scaling or flat?

Alway get flat (if it is available) unless you are in jg or in a back early match up

Scaling MR glyphs are often picked for lanes that are not against AP opponents, and on the junglers. In blind pick its a toss up, but in ranked you usually know what you're laning against and can eventually make two rune pages and choose between them.

CDR glyphs or quints are often taken as scaling on mages.

In my opinion you should byt flat AD marks and armor seals first. Then magic resistance glyphs. Then everything else you deem worth.

Armor because overall are useful for any class ( from junglers to mages, to mitigate monster damage and mitigate minion aggro and jungler ganks ) and flat AD because it' s a core for many junglers, that rely A LOT on runes, it' s good for any laner because lets them last hit better ( and also harrass with the auto attack the enemy, don' t forget that ) and makes your supports more of a threat.

This just to say what i deem the most important ones, then there is a way to optimize everything. like, you would like to have magic penetration marks for your mages ( most of the times), or AP glyphs, or attack speed marks for your udyr jungle. I do not even mention Quintessences because those are another matter totally.

I think I'll be maining {{champion:99}} Lux mid, or maybe a support like {{champion:99}} lux or {{champion:25}} morgana. Should I get runes more specialized for those two roles since I assume they will share some BiS runes?
What champion do you play the most?

flat armor yellows (seals)
flat magic resist blues (glyphs) which can always be swapped for scaling magic resist or even scaling cooldown reduction

on an ad page, I prefer getting
armor pen reds (marks) if you play ad assassins or if you want to scale as a caster adc such as {{champion:236}}  (here, take flat ad quints)
attack damage reds instead, if you play adc or juggernauts (here take attack speed quints)

on my ap page, I usually get
magic pen reds
ap quints if you usually go mid
magic pen quints if you usually go as a poke support like {{champion:117}}

once you have every champion (plus a spare 6300 for a possible new champion) you can buy more rune pages for these setups^

here's a good reddit post with a chart for every page you'll ever want, but the above two should get you going: https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/268xzk/the_only_runes_pages_you_need/
definetely armor yellows, dmg reds and mr blues, quints u do ap or dmg or AS
